CatDescriptText: Mr. Fred Coleman, steelworker, 139 Steuben Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" answer reads: "Some schools have very good counseling services.  And Langley High School, where my granddaughter attends, is one of them.  There the teachers help the children to develop their talents and tell them about the various jobs and how they can prepare for them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Fred Coleman wearing sheer short sleeve collared shirt, light colored tank top, and cap, standing next to Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
